business.headline: Elliott Hill's 32-year journey at Nike from intern to CEO goes viralElliott Hill, who has spent over 32 years at Nike, started his journey as an intern and will now be leading the iconic company.
Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty gains momentum; JSW Steel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 415.45 points at 83,600.25 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.80 points to trade at 25,550.90.

Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.
Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

Explained: Why small and midcap stocks are under pressure todayPublic Sector Undertaking (PSU) stocks, particularly in sectors such as defence, railways, and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), have been hit hard.
IT, banking, large-cap stocks: Strategies to boost portfolio after Fed rate cutWill the US Fed's rate cut boost opportunities on Dalal Street? Check these expert strategies to realign your portfolio.

HAL, IRFC, BHEL stocks fall: Here's why PSU stocks are under pressurePSU stocks fell even as India's benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, rose on the back of higher-than-expected interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve.

Explained: What US Fed's 50 bps rate cut means for Indian economyThe Fed's decision signalled a shift towards easing monetary policy, with experts divided on its implications for the global economy, including India. Here's a detailed look at how the bigger-than-expected rate cut could impact the Indian economy and the broader market.
Cisco cuts thousands of jobs in second biggest layoff of 2024: Report This latest round of layoffs follows a previous cut in February when Cisco let go of about 4,000 employees.

US Fed cuts rates by 50 bps: How will it affect Indian stock market?This is the first time the Fed has reduced rates since 2020, and it has been done to address slowing economic growth and easing inflation in the US.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty crosses 25,500 for 1st time; IT stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 758.7 points at 83,706.93 at 9:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 215.40 points to trade at 25,592.95.

US Fed slashes rates by 50 bps in first rate reduction since 2020Policymakers see the Fed's benchmark rate falling by another half of a percentage point by the end of this year, another full percentage point in 2025, and by a final half of a percentage point in 2026 to end in a 2.75 per cent-3.00 per cent range.
US Fed rate decision today at 11:30 pm – 5 things to watch outMarkets are widely expecting a 25-basis-point cut in the key interest rate, marking the first reduction in four years.

Tupperware, once a household name, files for bankruptcyTupperware Brands and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday. The company, widely known for its food storage containers, has been struggling with falling sales in recent years.

NPS Vatsalya: How to invest, eligibility criteria, and online buying guideNPS Vatsalya enables parents or guardians to open a pension account for minors and contribute as little as Rs 1,000 annually, making it accessible to families from various economic backgrounds.

Explained: Why IT stocks faced profit booking ahead of US Fed rate decisionMphasiS led the decline, dropping 5.6%, followed by L&T Technology Services, Persistent Systems, Tata Consultancy Services, HCL Technologies, and Tech Mahindra, which saw losses ranging from 3% to 4%.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel destroys 1,000 Hezbollah rocket launcher barrels, Middle East on boil Live updatesThe Israeli Defence Force (IDF) stated that the fighter jets struck 100 rocket launchers consisting of around 1,000 barrels that were about to be used to immediately fire towards Israeli territory.

Changed ghee brand behind 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' controversy?Chandrababu Naidu's claim, citing a lab report, that animal fat was found in the ghee procured during the YSR Congress Party regime has brought into focus the halt in the supply of the famous Nandini ghee last year.

Will never happen again: Rajiv Memani on EY missing funeral of employeeErnst and Young India chairperson Rajiv Memani has expressed regret on no one from the company attending the funeral of its employee, who died allegedly due to excessive work pressure.

Insaniyat dead, Jamhooriyat in ICU and Kashmiriyat buried as J&K goes for pollsIt is against a backdrop of colliding images that the Kashmir Valley is voting in an Assembly election for the first time in a decade.

Is it a good idea to have breakfast for dinner?Having breakfast for dinner can be an easy way to ensure nutritious food intake and avoid consuming junk or outside food, even with a busy work schedule. But there are a few things to keep in mind.

Biker dies after collision with SUV in Gurugram, deadly crash caught on cameraA biker, Akshat Garg, died after being hit by a Mahindra 3XO driving on the wrong side in Gurugram's DLF Phase II. Police have filed an FIR, and investigations are ongoing.

iPhone 16 first sale in India today: Check price, offers and moreiPhone 16 series, starting at Rs 79,900, is all set to hit the Indian market. The lineup will be available on both online and offline platforms. Here is how you can buy the iPhone 16 series at a lower price.

How pager blasts, Hamas chief killing have brought Middle East to brink of warIsrael-Hezbollah War: Even though the intensity of the hostilities has waxed and waned, there is no sign of a pause in the year-long war in Gaza. The pager blasts in Lebanon have further pushed the Middle East to the brink of a full-blown regional war.

Squid Game 2 teaser: Lee Jung-jae back with more contestants for deadly new gameThe teaser of the highly-anticipated season two of Squid Game is here. The first season of the popular Netflix series was released back in 2021.

Union Minister claims madrasas are threat to national security, foster terrorismUnion Minister and BJP leader Bandi Sanjay Kumar claimed that madrasas provide training to their pupils in making AK-47 rifles with the help of broomsticks.

5 Odisha cops suspended for alleged assault on Army officer, his fiancéeAn Indian Army officer and his fiancé The incident came to light when an army officer and his fiancée were allegedly assaulted at Bharatpur Police Station after attempting to report a road rage incident. The couple claimed that they were harassed by some people while driving.
Dhruvi Patel from US crowned Miss India Worldwide 2024Dhruvi Patel is a Computer Information System student from the USA, and she aspires to be a Bollywood actor and UNICEF Ambassador.

Watch: iPhone 16 sale kicks off with a countdown and long queue at Mumbai storeAs the highly anticipated sale of the iPhone 16 commenced in India, people showed up outside the Apple stores in Mumbai and Delhi to be the first ones to grab the new series phones of the major tech company. A video shared by news agency ANI showed a large number of people standing in a queue outside the company's store in Mumbai's BKC to get the mobile phones.

Kolkata doctors call off protest, to resume essential services from SaturdayJunior doctors protesting against the rape and murder of the trainee doctor will resume essential services from September 21.
I hate you (like I love you), Emily in ParisEmily Cooper's French visa is not expiring anytime soon. She is going to be on Netflix, and in our lives, for a long time.

Late Egyptian billionaire Mohamed al-Fayed accused of raping, abusing womenThe BBC documentary, 'al-Fayed: Predator at Harrods', claims that late billionaire Mohamed al-Fayed raped five women and sexually abused at least 15 others when they worked at the luxury department store.

Video: Armed robbers attack man inside shop in Punjab, flee with cash, mobileAt least four to five armed robbers entered a medical shop and attacked a man with sticks and sharp-edged weapons in Punjab's Moga district before fleeing away with cash and a mobile phone.

Odia singer Ruksana Bano dies at 27, family suspects poisoningOdia singer Ruksana Bano died on September 19 at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. The 27-year-old had been hospitalised since August 27, battling serious health complications.

Hezbollah fighters not ultimate target. 5 goals Israel scored with pager blastsIsrael has launched an offensive against Hezbollah in Lebanon. As thousands of pagers and electronic devices exploded across Lebanon in two days, experts suggested that Israel's ultimate aim through these detonations was much bigger than just targeting Hezbollah foot soldiers. These are the five big goals that Israel scored.

Raya's praise received a lot of praise for his effort.

IND vs BAN: 'Crisis-man' R Ashwin is underrated as a batter, says Tamim IqbalFormer Bangladesh opener Tamim Iqbal heaped praise on R Ashwin and claimed that the Indian star is underrated as a batter. Ashwin scored his 6th Test hundred on Day one of the Chennai  Test.

Anwar finally free to play for East Bengal after getting long-awaited NOCAnwar Ali has received the NOC to officially join East Bengal FC in the ISL after a legal dispute with Mohun Bagan. While the ban is lifted, his future awaits a final verdict later this month.

Moulded in Tamil Nadu T20 league, aggressive Ashwin does a Rishabh Pant in ChennaiIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: Having worked on improving his range of big shots in the Tamil Nadu Premier League earlier this year, R Ashwin flaunted his aggressive avatar, hitting his fastest Test hundred. Kane Williamson, Tom Latham lead strong New Zealand reply on Day 2Sri Lanka vs New Zealand, 2nd Test: Tom Latham and Kane Williamson came up with solid fifties as New Zealand put themselves in a position of strength against hosts Sri Lanka on a rain-hit Day 2 in Galle.

Bangladesh missed a trick by holding back Shakib: Tamim IqbalIND vs BAN: Shakib Al Hasan did not have the best of days after he had figures of 8-0-50-0 on Day 1 of Bangladesh's first Test against India at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
